intro: Glyphostylus laoticus, commonly known as the Laotian mistflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Laos. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often along forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a mild aromatic scent when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Glyphostylus laoticus is considered a vulnerable species.
